name: X-raying X Words Multiple Choice Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Xe.

	Xenon was discovered by Sir William Ramsey and Morris M Travers. Its natural state is a gas. Its atomic number is 54. Morris M Travers was also an authority on glass technology.

questions.text: What is the name found on the bottoms of Cabbage Patch dolls?
questions.explanation:
Xavier.

	The name Xavier appears because cabbage Patch dolls were created by Xavier Roberts in the 1980s.

questions.text: Which is a monetary unit in Vietnam?
questions.explanation:
Xu.

	XA is an acronym that had many meaning among them being "Exchange Access" and "Extended Architecture". Xi is both the number 11 in Roman numerals as well as being the 14th letter of the Greek alphabet. Xe is the chemical symbol for Xenon.

questions.text: How do you say "thank you" in Mandarin Chinese?
questions.explanation:
Xie xie.

	Xiyan means to smoke. Xiansheng means mister. Xuesheng means student.

Xingjian, Gao.

	Gao Xingjian won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 2000. He wrote the book "The Other Shore" which was banned in China. This caused him to move to France,as a political refugee, where he later became a citizen.

questions.text: What is the fear of dryness called?
questions.explanation:
Xerophobia.

	Xanthophobia is fear of the color yellow. Xenophobia is fear of strangers and xyrophobia is fear of razors.

questions.text: What did William D. Coolidge invent?
questions.explanation:
X-Ray tube.

	The X-Ray tube is more commonly known as the Coolidge Tube. Coolidge was born in 1873 and died in 1965. He did most of his work with General Electric. He retired after WWII but continued to be a consultant until 1965.

questions.text: What character did Lucy Lawless play on TV that was from a spin-off of Hercules: The Legend Continues?
questions.explanation:
Xena.

	Lucy Lawless was born on March 29, 1968 in Mount Albert, New Zealand.

questions.text: Which of the following words has nothing to do with plants?
questions.explanation:
xyst.

	Xyst (or xystus) is a roofed area where athletes trained in ancient Greece. Xenia (as well as Xenial) is the effect of pollen on certain plant structures. Xylan is substance found in cell walls of plants.

questions.text: Which of the following words is a type of vessel?
questions.explanation:
xebec.

	The xebec is a Mediterranian sailing vessel. The xebec was around from about 1650-1820. You can see a picture of a model xebec at the following link: http://www.geocities.com/xebecinc/algerianxebec.jpg.
